column2: The four parts of the fire tetrahedron are fuel, heat, oxygen, and a chemical chain reaction. If any of the four sides of the tetrahedron are removed, the fire goes out.

column1: What is an uninhibited chemical chain reaction in regards to the fire tetrahedron?
column2: The combining process of fuel, heat, and oxygen in the proper amounts to sustain flaming combustion or a fire.
